translated: As is said:

original: mthong ba la sogs pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs pa dang bral ba /
translated: Free from seeing and so forth,

original: brjod pas thog tu mi @252a * //
analyzed: brjod pas thog tu mi @252a * //
translated: it cannot be reached by words.

original: phebs pa'i rang rig pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: phebs pa'i rang rig pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is the characteristic of the pristine wisdom of self-awareness.

original: de bas brjod par mi nus so //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bas brjod par mi nus so // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, it cannot be expressed.

original: de nyid la spros pa'i mtshan ma thams cad kyis brjod du med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid la spros pa'i mtshan ma thams cad kyis brjod du med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is because all elaborations and signs are inexpressible in it.

original: de skad du //
analyzed: de skad du //
translated: As is said:

original: rang bzhin ye shes ye shes tshig dang bral //
analyzed: rang bzhin ye shes ye shes tshig dang bral //
translated: The nature is pristine wisdom, free from the words of pristine wisdom.

original: sgra la sogs pa'i chos kyis stong //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i chos kyis stong //
translated: It is empty of phenomena such as sound and so forth.

original: brjod med ma skyes ma 'gags pa //
analyzed: brjod med ma skyes ma 'gags pa //
translated: It is inexpressible, unborn, and unceasing,

original: rang rig pa yi bdag nyid do //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang rig pa yi bdag nyid do // zhes gsungs so //
translated: the nature of self-awareness.

original: 'on kyang kun rdzob kyi thabs kyi rim pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang kun rdzob kyi thabs kyi rim pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di'o //
translated: Nevertheless, the characteristic of the stage of the relative method is this:

original: de kho'i bdag gsum de snang ba //
analyzed: de kho'i bdag gsum de snang ba //
translated: The three natures of that appear.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa snang ba'i ye shes bzhi'i rim pa dang sbyar te bshad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa snang ba'i ye shes bzhi'i rim pa dang sbyar te bshad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: awareness of appearance are explained in this way.”

original: / cha dang thig le dang ni tshul //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: / cha dang thig le dang ni tshul // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The passage beginning “The parts, the bindus, and the modes”🔽is explained as having the meaning of the stage of completion in

original: 'khor lo la sogs pa dang sbyar nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i don du bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor lo la sogs pa dang sbyar nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i don du bshad pa ni /
translated: connection with the cakras, and so forth.🔽This was taught by the great king Nābhāma🔽pa’s nirmāṇakāya. Since he is the great guru, I also explain this

original: dpal rgyal po chen po na bh'um t'i sprul pa'i skus bka' stsal te de nyid bla ma chen po yin pas bdag kyang de la brten te bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dpal rgyal po chen po na bh'um t'i sprul pa'i skus bka' stsal te de nyid bla ma chen po yin pas bdag kyang de la brten te bshad pa'o //
translated: based on him.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said,🔽“The prophecy in the glorious Jñānatilakottara Tantra will appear

original: dpal ye shes thig le'i rgyud las lung bstan pa 'og nas 'byung ste /🔽de nyid kyis mdzad pa'i man ngag gis 'di'i don khong du chung par bya'o //
analyzed: dpal ye shes thig le'i rgyud las lung bstan pa 'og nas 'byung ste / de nyid kyis mdzad pa'i man ngag gis 'di'i don khong du chung par bya'o //
translated: below.”🔽The meaning of this should be understood through the esoteric🔽instructions of that master.🔽Since this was composed with the meaning of the Tattva-pradīpa Tantra

original: de yang de kho na nyid kyi sgron ma'i rgyud kyi don dang 'di la dgongs nas mdzad pa yin pas 'dir drang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: de yang de kho na nyid kyi sgron ma'i rgyud kyi don dang 'di la dgongs nas mdzad pa yin pas 'dir drang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas /
translated: in mind, it should be interpreted in this way.

original: rgyud rnams su rgyas btab nas bzhugs pa ni /
analyzed: rgyud rnams su rgyas btab nas bzhugs pa ni /
translated: The tantras are sealed, and they remain🔽so in dependence on the guru's word, because one will attain power without🔽doubt through the esoteric instructions of the means of achievement, the

original: bla ma'i bka' la brten te sgrub thabs dang / 'grel pa la sogs pa'i man ngag gis the tshom med par dngos grub rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir //
analyzed: bla ma'i bka' la brten te sgrub thabs dang / 'grel pa la sogs pa'i man ngag gis the tshom med par dngos grub rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir //
translated: commentaries, and so forth.🔽I have also included in this treatise on the esoteric instructions composed

original: bdag gis kyang bla ma dam pa chen pos mdzad pa'i man ngag gi gzhung 'dir btsud cing bla ma dam pa la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis kyang bla ma dam pa chen pos mdzad pa'i man ngag gi gzhung 'dir btsud cing bla ma dam pa la brten pa yin no //
translated: by the great holy guru the dependence on the holy guru.

original: dngos po rten la sogs bye brag //
analyzed: dngos po rten la sogs bye brag //
translated: The various things, the basis, and so forth,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: are taught.

original: bde ba chen po'i rgyal po rang bzhin dga' ba 'di ni brjod pa dang bral ba yin na yang /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i rgyal po rang bzhin dga' ba 'di ni brjod pa dang bral ba yin na yang /
translated: This king of great bliss, natural joy, is inexpressible,🔽but it is taught through the characteristics of the inconceivable variety of

original: thabs kyi bye brag bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: thabs kyi bye brag bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gsungs so //
translated: methods.

original: da ni 'bras bu'i don bshad do /🔽kun rdzob rnams pa'i gzugs kyis ni //
analyzed: da ni 'bras bu'i don bshad do / kun rdzob rnams pa'i gzugs kyis ni //
translated: Now, the meaning of the result will be explained.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The various things, the basis, and so forth,🔽are taught.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa la sogs pa'i sku kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid can gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa ji snyed pa las 'grol ba la /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa la sogs pa'i sku kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid can gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa ji snyed pa las 'grol ba la /
translated: The sambhogakāya and so forth, which have the characteristic of the conventional truth, are liberated from the extent of the concepts of subject and object.

original: @252b byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i spyod yul gyi gnas su gyur pa'o //🔽chu yi zla ba bzhin du mthong //
analyzed: @252b byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i spyod yul gyi gnas su gyur pa'o // chu yi zla ba bzhin du mthong //
translated: They become the abode of the domain of the conduct of the bodhisattvas and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The sambhogakāya is seen like the moon in the water.

original: ji ltar chu'i zla ba'i gzugs brnyan gcig shar bas chu'i snod kyi bye brag tha dad pa rnams su snang zhing gsal pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar chu'i zla ba'i gzugs brnyan gcig shar bas chu'i snod kyi bye brag tha dad pa rnams su snang zhing gsal pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as the reflection of the moon in the water appears and manifests in the different individual vessels of water,

original: rdo rje 'dzin pas kyang gzugs kyi sku'i bdag nyid ni //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pas kyang gzugs kyi sku'i bdag nyid ni //
translated: so the nature of the rūpakāya of the vajra holder

original: rang rang gi bsam pa dang / mos pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du gsal zhing mthong ngo //
analyzed: rang rang gi bsam pa dang / mos pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du gsal zhing mthong ngo //
translated: is seen and manifested in accordance with the individual thoughts, aspirations, and so forth.

original: 'on kyang snod dang chu la skyon yod pa'i zla ba ni de lta ma yin te /🔽de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'on kyang snod dang chu la skyon yod pa'i zla ba ni de lta ma yin te / de bzhin du /
translated: However, the moon in a vessel or water that is defective is not like that.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i snod kyang skyon med cing dag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i snod kyang skyon med cing dag par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the vessel of the practitioner should be made faultless and pure.

original: de nyid ni gzugs kyi sku'i rang bzhin snod skyon dang bral ba'i bdag nyid la snang ngo //
analyzed: de nyid ni gzugs kyi sku'i rang bzhin snod skyon dang bral ba'i bdag nyid la snang ngo //
translated: That very [nature] appears in the nature of the form body, which is the nature free from the faults of a vessel.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: ji ltar ri bong can gyi gzugs //
analyzed: ji ltar ri bong can gyi gzugs //
translated: Just as the form of the moon

original: skyon med chu la snang ba bzhin //
analyzed: skyon med chu la snang ba bzhin //
translated: appears in faultless water,

original: bde chen rnam rtog bral ba yang //
analyzed: bde chen rnam rtog bral ba yang //
translated: so the great bliss free from conceptuality

original: rang sems dag la so sor snang //
analyzed: rang sems dag la so sor snang //
translated: appears individually in the pure mind.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / yang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / yang /
translated: And also:

original: ji ltar zla ba bshad gyur pa //
analyzed: ji ltar zla ba bshad gyur pa //
translated: Just as the moon is explained,

original: tshad med gzugs brnyan snang ba rnams //
analyzed: tshad med gzugs brnyan snang ba rnams //
translated: the appearances of immeasurable reflections

original: dang ba'i chu snod snang 'gyur yang //
analyzed: dang ba'i chu snod snang 'gyur yang //
translated: appear in the vessel of clear water,

original: zla ba'i gzugs ni gnyis 'gyur med //
analyzed: zla ba'i gzugs ni gnyis 'gyur med //
translated: but the form of the moon does not become two.

original: de bzhin chags bral mkhyen ldan rnams //
analyzed: de bzhin chags bral mkhyen ldan rnams //
translated: In the same way, those who are free from attachment and possess knowledge

original: chags med rnam par 'tshang rgya ba //
analyzed: chags med rnam par 'tshang rgya ba //
translated: attain enlightenment without attachment,

original: zhing rnams kun la so sor snang //
analyzed: zhing rnams kun la so sor snang //
translated: appearing individually in all realms,

original: sangs rgyas nyid la gnyis kyis kyang med //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid la gnyis kyis kyang med // ces gsungs so //
translated: but buddhahood itself is not dual.

original: ngon dam pa yi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ngon dam pa yi rang bzhin no //
translated: The ultimate nature

original: yang dag rtogs pa'i gnas med do //
analyzed: yang dag rtogs pa'i gnas med do //
translated: is not the abode of correct realization.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is said:

original: chos kyi sku spros pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ni yang dag pa 'di yin no zhes /
analyzed: chos kyi sku spros pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ni yang dag pa 'di yin no zhes /
translated: This is the characteristic of the Dharmakāya free from conceptual elaborations.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang mi gzigs pa de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang mi gzigs pa de /
translated: Even all the Buddhas do not see it.

original: don dam par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don dam par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the ultimate truth is

original: yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin te /
translated: not existent.

original: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs kyi snying po gsang ba las kyang ches gsang ba /
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs kyi snying po gsang ba las kyang ches gsang ba /
translated: That is the essence of the mind of all the Tathāgatas, more secret than secret,

original: skye ba med pa /
analyzed: skye ba med pa /
translated: unborn,

original: 'gag pa med pa /
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa /
translated: unceasing,

original: chos thams cad kyi chos nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi chos nyid do //
translated: the reality of all phenomena.

original: da ni de la sgrub pa'i thabs bshad de /
analyzed: da ni de la sgrub pa'i thabs bshad de /
translated: Now, the method of practice is explained.

original: thabs la sogs pa'i rim pa yis //
analyzed: thabs la sogs pa'i rim pa yis //
translated: By the stages of the method and so forth,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so forth is stated.

original: de ltar yang de kho na nyid gsum gyi bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar yang de kho na nyid gsum gyi bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Thus, the self of the three realities and so forth,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / thabs kyi mtshan nyid sngar gong du bshad kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / thabs kyi mtshan nyid sngar gong du bshad kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that although the characteristics of cause, effect, and method were previously explained above, the meaning is that they are explained again.

original: 'dir yang rgyu'i don bshad par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dir yang rgyu'i don bshad par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: Here, in order to explain the meaning of the cause,

original: de kho na nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid ni /
analyzed: de kho na nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid ni /
translated: the essence of the three realities

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The aspect of the foundation consciousness.🔽

original: @253a * // rnam par shes pa gsum gyi bdag nyid rgyu'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: @253a * // rnam par shes pa gsum gyi bdag nyid rgyu'i rang bzhin /
translated: The form of the store-consciousness is the nature of the cause of the three consciousnesses.

original: rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: The root consciousness is the nature of the store-consciousness.🔽The nature of the consciousnesses of mind, etc., is the characteristic of the nature of the root consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i yid la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bye brag gi rang bzhi gi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i yid la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bye brag gi rang bzhi gi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is the representation.

original: mang po'i mtshan nyid gsal ba gang yin pa de ni rnam pa'o //🔽yang na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: mang po'i mtshan nyid gsal ba gang yin pa de ni rnam pa'o // yang na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: The form is that which manifests the characteristic of the many.

original: lus dang ngag yid gsum dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lus dang ngag yid gsum dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or else, the store-consciousness is the consciousness of the body, speech, and mind.🔽This is the meaning of the verse.

original: de'i don gyis gzhan dag kyang bshad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i don gyis gzhan dag kyang bshad par bya ba yin no //
translated: The other terms should be explained according to this meaning.

original: zla ba de mchog gi tshogs kyi rnam par shes pa'i mtha'i tshad do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zla ba de mchog gi tshogs kyi rnam par shes pa'i mtha'i tshad do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The moon is the measure of the end of the consciousness of the supreme assembly.

original: tshogs ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: tshogs ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: The assembly is the consciousnesses of the eye, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin no //
translated: This is the nature of the cause of the bodhisattva.

original: rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: Consciousness

original: gong dang 'og gi khyad par gyi bdag por 'gyur te /
analyzed: gong dang 'og gi khyad par gyi bdag por 'gyur te /
translated: is the lord of the distinctions above and below.

original: shes shing rig pa'o //
analyzed: shes shing rig pa'o //
translated: It is knowing and awareness.

original: mtha' ni 'khor rnams dang gnas dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' ni 'khor rnams dang gnas dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The end is said to be the retinue together with the abode.

original: tshad ni sngar bshad pa rnams dang / phyis 'byung ba rnams gtan la phab pa'i tshad do //
analyzed: tshad ni sngar bshad pa rnams dang / phyis 'byung ba rnams gtan la phab pa'i tshad do //
translated: The measure is the measure of determining what was explained before and what will occur later.

original: phyag rgya chen po yid kyi rnam par shes pa /🔽rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po yid kyi rnam par shes pa / rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The great seal is mental consciousness.🔽One's own nature

original: yid nyid gtso bor gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yid nyid gtso bor gsungs pa yin te /
translated: is said to be the mind itself, which is the principal one.

original: bsgrub pa dang / sgrub pa po dang / bsgrub par bya ba thams cad yid kyi cho 'phrul gyis byed do //
analyzed: bsgrub pa dang / sgrub pa po dang / bsgrub par bya ba thams cad yid kyi cho 'phrul gyis byed do //
translated: The accomplishment, the practitioner, and all that is to be accomplished are created by the magic display of the mind.

original: snang ba nyi bdag po phyag rgya chen po'i ngo bo grub pas kun rdzob dang mthun par snang ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: snang ba nyi bdag po phyag rgya chen po'i ngo bo grub pas kun rdzob dang mthun par snang ba'i ye shes so //
translated: The appearance is the lord of the great seal, the wisdom that appears in accordance with the relative.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni de rang thams cad kyi ngo bor grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni de rang thams cad kyi ngo bor grub pa yin no //
translated: One's own nature is the nature of all of them.

original: de rnams kyi kun gzhi ni rgya la /
analyzed: de rnams kyi kun gzhi ni rgya la /
translated: The all-basis of those is the seal.

original: gzhan dag ni 'bras bu yin pa dang / kun rdzob kyi gnas thabs ni sems can rnams la rgyu'i bdag nyid du gnas pa las /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'bras bu yin pa dang / kun rdzob kyi gnas thabs ni sems can rnams la rgyu'i bdag nyid du gnas pa las /
translated: The other [natures] are effects.

original: 'bras bu 'byung ba'i mthu dang ldan par yod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byung ba'i mthu dang ldan par yod do //
translated: The method of abiding of the conventional is that it exists in sentient beings in the form of a cause, having the power to produce an effect.

original: de skad du //
analyzed: de skad du //
translated: Thus it is said:

original: de nyid gsum dag rgyur ni grags //
analyzed: de nyid gsum dag rgyur ni grags //
translated: The three realities are known as the cause.

original: zla ba la sogs 'bras bdag nyid //
analyzed: zla ba la sogs 'bras bdag nyid //
translated: The moon, etc., are the nature of the effect.

original: ces bya ba dang / yang dag mtha' dang rnam par shes //
analyzed: ces bya ba dang / yang dag mtha' dang rnam par shes //
translated: And: The limit of reality and consciousness

original: chu yi zla ba bzhin du mthong //
analyzed: chu yi zla ba bzhin du mthong //
translated: Are seen like the moon in the water.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / sems can sangs rgyas rang bzhin pas //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / sems can sangs rgyas rang bzhin pas //
translated: And: Since sentient beings have the nature of a buddha,

original: 'on kyang glo bur dri mas khyab //
analyzed: 'on kyang glo bur dri mas khyab //
translated: However, they are pervaded by adventitious stains.

original: de sangs rgyas na ni sangs rgyas rgyas nyid //🔽nges par yin par the tshom med //
analyzed: de sangs rgyas na ni sangs rgyas rgyas nyid // nges par yin par the tshom med //
translated: When they are purified, they are definitely buddhas.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: There is no doubt.

original: da ni de rang nyid don dam pa'i mtshan nyid bshad de /
analyzed: da ni de rang nyid don dam pa'i mtshan nyid bshad de /
translated: Now, the definition of ultimate reality itself will be explained.

original: de'i mtha' la rnam pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam mkha'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i mtha' la rnam pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam mkha'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The space of consciousness without aspects is the limit of that.

original: rang @253b bzhin gyis stong pa nyid dpe nam mkhas kyang gzhal du mad pa /
analyzed: rang @253b bzhin gyis stong pa nyid dpe nam mkhas kyang gzhal du mad pa /
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic nature is also immeasurable by the example of space.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ye shes spros pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ye shes spros pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The wisdom of emptiness is free from conceptual elaborations.

original: yang na sprul pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni //
analyzed: yang na sprul pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni //
translated: Again, “emanation” and so on.

original: sems can la rtsa'i 'khor lo rnams rang bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can la rtsa'i 'khor lo rnams rang bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir //
translated: Since the cakras are naturally present in sentient beings,

original: de kho na nyid gsum la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhin sbyar ba'i don ni der bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid gsum la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhin sbyar ba'i don ni der bshad pa yin no //
translated: the meaning of the application of the three realities and so on is explained there.

original: yang na rtsa bzhi'i don du /
analyzed: yang na rtsa bzhi'i don du /
translated: Or, it is for the meaning of the four nāḍīs.

original: rnam pa la sogs pa shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa la sogs pa shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should understand the aspects and so on”

original: 'di yang rang bzhin gyis gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rang bzhin gyis gnas pa ste /
translated: is also naturally present.

original: 'o na srog ma ni de kho na nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi rnam pa'o //🔽'dzin pa ni zla bde mchog gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'o na srog ma ni de kho na nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi rnam pa'o // 'dzin pa ni zla bde mchog gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The rasanā is the aspect of the three realities.🔽The lalanā is the characteristic of the supreme moon.

original: ro ma ni phyag rgya chen po'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ro ma ni phyag rgya chen po'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The avadhūti is the essence of the great seal.

original: rtog med ma ni rnam pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i mtha' rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rtog med ma ni rnam pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i mtha' rang bzhin no //
translated: The “nonconceptual” is the ultimate nature free from aspects and so on.

original: sems can rnams la rtsa'i 'khor lo dang / rnam par shes pa rnams dang / rtsa bzhi po dang ldan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can rnams la rtsa'i 'khor lo dang / rnam par shes pa rnams dang / rtsa bzhi po dang ldan pa'i phyir //
translated: Because sentient beings have the channel-wheels, the consciousnesses, and the four channels,

original: rgyu'i dpal ye shes thig ler bshad pa dang / lhag ma yang sngon bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i dpal ye shes thig ler bshad pa dang / lhag ma yang sngon bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: the meaning of the glorious wisdom-tidle is explained as the cause, and the rest should be understood as before.

original: dpal ye shes thig le'i dka' 'grel gsang ba'i de kho na nyid ces ba le'u bcu drug pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: dpal ye shes thig le'i dka' 'grel gsang ba'i de kho na nyid ces ba le'u bcu drug pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the sixteenth chapter of the Secret of Secrets, the glorious wisdom-tidle.

original: // / sbyor ba drug la sogs pa'i don gyis rang bzhin dga' ba mchog gi nam mkha'i bdag nyid kyi don gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / sbyor ba drug la sogs pa'i don gyis rang bzhin dga' ba mchog gi nam mkha'i bdag nyid kyi don gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of the six applications and so forth is the meaning of the space of supreme innate joy, which is taught as follows.

original: de nas lha mo rab tu dgyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽dur khrod pa la sogs pa'i don zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas lha mo rab tu dgyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // dur khrod pa la sogs pa'i don zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Then the goddess is very pleased, and so forth.

original: dur khrod dang / shing dang / lha mo dang / rtsa la sogs pa'i don bcom ldan 'das nyid le nges par zhu ba'i don to //🔽me bzad 'di ni rnam par khyab //
analyzed: dur khrod dang / shing dang / lha mo dang / rtsa la sogs pa'i don bcom ldan 'das nyid le nges par zhu ba'i don to // me bzad 'di ni rnam par khyab //
translated: The meaning of the charnel ground and so forth is the meaning of the charnel ground, the tree, the goddess, the channel, and so forth, which is the meaning of the Bhagavat himself, the chapter of definite inquiry.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This fire is extinguished and is all-pervading.

original: rus pa la sogs rab bkram khyab ;
analyzed: rus pa la sogs rab bkram khyab ;
translated: The bones, etc., are spread out and pervade.

original: / ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: / ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: This explains

original: phyi'i dur khrod dang / nang gi yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi'i dur khrod dang / nang gi yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: the outer charnel ground and the inner one.

original: gsang ba'i nges pa'i don gyi dur khrod ni /
analyzed: gsang ba'i nges pa'i don gyi dur khrod ni /
translated: The secret definitive meaning charnel ground

original: ga bur gzhan min zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don gyis bshad do //
analyzed: ga bur gzhan min zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don gyis bshad do //
translated: is explained by the meaning of “camphor is not other,” and so on.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad bdag med par sngon pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad bdag med par sngon pa'i phyir //
translated: Since all worldly realms are previously purified as selfless,

original: dur khrod kyi dngos po bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dur khrod kyi dngos po bshad pa yin no //
translated: the charnel ground is explained as a thing.

original: de yang phyi'i don rang la rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid du bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de yang phyi'i don rang la rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid du bshad pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the explanation of the outer meaning as perfect in oneself

original: nang dag gsang ba'i dur khrod do //
analyzed: nang dag gsang ba'i dur khrod do //
translated: is the inner, secret charnel ground.🔽In the same way, since the meaning of this tantra, the Shri

original: de bzhin du dpal ye shes thig le'i rgyud 'di'i don bshad pas sgom pa po dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms phar bya ba'i don dam pa'i phyogs su @254a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal ye shes thig le'i rgyud 'di'i don bshad pas sgom pa po dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms phar bya ba'i don dam pa'i phyogs su @254a * //
translated: Wisdom-Essence, is explained, the meditator, the meditation, and the

original: dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin te /
analyzed: dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin te /
translated: ultimate meaning of the meditation are inseparable by nature.

original: 'on kyang kun rdzob thabs kyi bye brag tu sgom po dang / bsgom pa dang / sgom par bya ba ni mi snang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang kun rdzob thabs kyi bye brag tu sgom po dang / bsgom pa dang / sgom par bya ba ni mi snang ngo //
translated: However, the meditation, the meditator, and the object of meditation do not appear as the particularities of the relative method.

original: de'i phyir rgyu'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes thig le la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes thig le la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the essence of the cause is taught as the bindu of pristine consciousness, and so on.

original: de bzhin du shing la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad kyang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shing la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad kyang bshad pa'o //
translated: Likewise, all things, such as trees, are explained.

original: 'on kyang 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir bshad pa /
translated: However, here it is explained:

original: 'di la rtsa ba'i 'khor lo'i lte bar srog rtsa dang lhan cig bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di la rtsa ba'i 'khor lo'i lte bar srog rtsa dang lhan cig bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In this [mandala], the life channel is together with the navel of the root cakra, and so on.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows:

original: srog rtsa'i nang du 'gro ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: srog rtsa'i nang du 'gro ba ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three movements in the life channel:

original: 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'gro ba grub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'gro ba grub par byed pa'o //
translated: the movement that establishes the entry, the abiding, and the departure.

original: 'od kyi bdag nyid gtum mo 'jug par byed /
analyzed: 'od kyi bdag nyid gtum mo 'jug par byed /
translated: The one with the nature of light is the entry of caṇḍālī.

original: gzung 'dzin dang bral ba rtog med ma gnas par byed /
analyzed: gzung 'dzin dang bral ba rtog med ma gnas par byed /
translated: The one free from the apprehender and apprehended is the abiding of nonconceptuality.

original: ye shes kyi rang bzhin bya gdong ma 'gro bar byed /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rang bzhin bya gdong ma 'gro bar byed /
translated: The one with the nature of pristine consciousness is the departure of the bird-faced one.

original: yang na g-yas phyogs kyi ro can nam 'gro bar byed /
analyzed: yang na g-yas phyogs kyi ro can nam 'gro bar byed /
translated: Alternatively, the one with the right side is the departure.

original: g-yon byed 'dzin ma 'dug par byed /
analyzed: g-yon byed 'dzin ma 'dug par byed /
translated: The left one, the “holding,” causes it to remain.

original: dbus su gnas pa'i rtog med ma byang chub kyi sems gnas par byed do //
analyzed: dbus su gnas pa'i rtog med ma byang chub kyi sems gnas par byed do //
translated: The one in the middle, the “non-conceptual,” causes the bodhicitta to remain.

original: des ni dga' ba'i bzhi'i gnas kyang bstan //
analyzed: des ni dga' ba'i bzhi'i gnas kyang bstan //
translated: This also teaches the four joys.

original: dngos po ni /
analyzed: dngos po ni /
translated: The entity is

original: thog ma'i sku'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: thog ma'i sku'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: the characteristic of the body at the beginning.

original: de bzhin du dbus dang tha ma'i gsung dang thugs kyang ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbus dang tha ma'i gsung dang thugs kyang ye shes so //
translated: Similarly, the speech and mind in the middle and at the end are gnosis.

original: rnam pa'i 'byed pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa'i 'byed pa ni /
translated: The analysis of the aspects is

original: gsum gyi bdag nyid rtog med ma'i ngo bo dang rang bzhin dga' ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gsum gyi bdag nyid rtog med ma'i ngo bo dang rang bzhin dga' ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the nature of the three, the essence of the non-conceptual, and the characteristic of the joy of the nature.

original: de skad du ;
analyzed: de skad du ;
translated: Thus it is said:

original: gsum gyi dngos po gsum pa bdag nyid //
analyzed: gsum gyi dngos po gsum pa bdag nyid //
translated: The entity of the three is the third nature.

original: thog ma tha ma rnam par byed //
analyzed: thog ma tha ma rnam par byed //
translated: It is the beginning and end, the analysis.

original: rtsa dang dga' bdag nyid skye med //
analyzed: rtsa dang dga' bdag nyid skye med //
translated: The channel and the joy are the nature of the unborn.

original: de'i phyir rtog med rang bzhin dga' //🔽zhes gsungs te //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog med rang bzhin dga' // zhes gsungs te //
translated: Therefore, the non-conceptual is the joy of the nature.

original: zhal bzang ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhal bzang ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one called “the beautiful face”

original: bcom ldan 'das ma la bos nas nges pa'i don la bstan pa'o //🔽der shes par bya zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma la bos nas nges pa'i don la bstan pa'o // der shes par bya zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is addressed to the Bhagavatī and teaches the definitive meaning.🔽“There” means

original: rtsa bzhi po'i don gyis /
analyzed: rtsa bzhi po'i don gyis /
translated: that the meaning of the four channels is to be understood.

original: rtsa rnams thams cad kyi don shes par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa rnams thams cad kyi don shes par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The meaning of all the nāḍīs is understood.

original: yang kha cig yang dag pa'i man ngag dang bral bas drang ba'i don gyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
analyzed: yang kha cig yang dag pa'i man ngag dang bral bas drang ba'i don gyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: Moreover, some, lacking the right instruction, follow the provisional meaning

original: rtsa'i man ngag gi ye shes la skur pa 'debs par 'gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: rtsa'i man ngag gi ye shes la skur pa 'debs par 'gyur pa yin te /
translated: and deprecate the pristine consciousness of the instruction of the nāḍīs.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag gi thun mong gi man ngag tsam la rten nas nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de dag gi thun mong gi man ngag tsam la rten nas nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because they do not have experience based on the common instructions,

original: mkhas pa rnams ni de dag la yid ches par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams ni de dag la yid ches par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the wise will not believe them.

original: de'i rtog pa de bsal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i rtog pa de bsal ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to dispel their doubts,

original: 'dir yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir yang gsungs pa /
translated: here it is said:

original: shar dang nub pa'i dus su rtsa'i 'khor lo 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @254b so ;
analyzed: shar dang nub pa'i dus su rtsa'i 'khor lo 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @254b so ;
translated: “The arising of the cakras of the nāḍīs at the time of sunrise and sunset” and so on.

original: da ni rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gi don bshad de /
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gi don bshad de /
translated: Now, the meaning of the lord of yogins will be explained:

original: yid dang mthun pa'i rang gnas su //
analyzed: yid dang mthun pa'i rang gnas su //
translated: In a place that is agreeable to oneself,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
translated: and so on.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i spyod pa dang mthun pa'i gnas gang yang rung ba der sgrub pa po yid 'jug pas na'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i spyod pa dang mthun pa'i gnas gang yang rung ba der sgrub pa po yid 'jug pas na'o //
translated: In any place suitable for the conduct of a yogi, the adept should enter with his mind.

original: gzhan gyi gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi gnas te /
translated: In another's place

original: phyi la sogs pa dang bral ba'i gnas ni rang gi gnas rang khyim zhes brda'i don to //
analyzed: phyi la sogs pa dang bral ba'i gnas ni rang gi gnas rang khyim zhes brda'i don to //
translated: means in a place free from others, etc. The meaning of the conventional term is one's own place, one's own house.

original: skyon ni 'byung po la sogs pa'i bar chad byed pa'i dngos po rnams spang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyon ni 'byung po la sogs pa'i bar chad byed pa'i dngos po rnams spang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Faults means the things that cause obstacles, such as spirits. The meaning is that they should be abandoned.

original: thams cad ni rgyal po dang / mu stegs dang / cho ma rkun la sogs pa rnams med par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad ni rgyal po dang / mu stegs dang / cho ma rkun la sogs pa rnams med par bya ba'i don to //
translated: Everything means the absence of kings, tīrthikas, thieves, and so on.

original: yang na rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid rnams skyon te /
analyzed: yang na rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid rnams skyon te /
translated: Or, the characteristics of conceptuality are faults.

original: 'di rnams kyis rnal 'byor pa la gnod par mi 'gyur ba ni skyon thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis rnal 'byor pa la gnod par mi 'gyur ba ni skyon thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: Since these do not harm the yogi, free from all faults is said.

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa'i thad chad par 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin ni sra ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa'i thad chad par 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin ni sra ba'o //
translated: The nature of the hard is conceptual.

original: spangs pa ni gnyid kyis spyod pa la dben pa'i thabs kyi bye brag gis de spangs pa'i don to //
analyzed: spangs pa ni gnyid kyis spyod pa la dben pa'i thabs kyi bye brag gis de spangs pa'i don to //
translated: Abandonment means the abandonment of the meaning of that by the means of isolation of the practice of sleep.

original: ye shes dang ldan pa'i sku'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i lus pos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes dang ldan pa'i sku'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i lus pos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The body that abides in the nature of the body endowed with intuition is called the “body of bliss.”

original: phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa'i rba rlabs g-yeng ba'i phyir na rlabs so //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa'i rba rlabs g-yeng ba'i phyir na rlabs so //
translated: Because of the distraction of the waves of conceptualization that are errors, they are waves.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rgya mtsho gsal ba'i spyod pa ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rgya mtsho gsal ba'i spyod pa ni bde ba'o //
translated: The practice that illuminates the ocean of nondual intuition is bliss.

original: bde ba'i stan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bde ba'i stan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The “seat of bliss” is

original: bde ba chen po thob par byed pa'i rgyu ni ;
analyzed: bde ba chen po thob par byed pa'i rgyu ni ;
translated: the cause of attaining great bliss.

original: stan 'jam pa la sogs pa yin pas /
analyzed: stan 'jam pa la sogs pa yin pas /
translated: Since it is a soft seat, etc.,🔽it is illustrated by a lotus, etc.

original: padma la sogs pas mtshon pa yin pas 'di skad du /
analyzed: padma la sogs pas mtshon pa yin pas 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'dir ni dga' ba'i gdan bshams te /
analyzed: 'dir ni dga' ba'i gdan bshams te /
translated: Here, a seat of joy is prepared,

original: sna tshogs padma ras kyis g-yogs //
analyzed: sna tshogs padma ras kyis g-yogs //
translated: covered with a cloth of various lotuses.

original: stan de dag ni thams cad la //
analyzed: stan de dag ni thams cad la //
translated: On all of those seats

original: ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du dgod //🔽ces gsungs so //🔽lte ba'i dbus na yod pa'i tshul //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du dgod // ces gsungs so // lte ba'i dbus na yod pa'i tshul //
translated: one should be placed according to his place.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The “method of existing in the middle of the navel” is

original: sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i lte ba'i gsung rdo rje'i sa bon /
analyzed: sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i lte ba'i gsung rdo rje'i sa bon /
translated: The seed of the speech vajra in the center of the emanation wheel

original: bdag med ma'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid can shes rab ma'i don to /
analyzed: bdag med ma'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid can shes rab ma'i don to /
translated: is the characteristic called the “cause of Nairātmya,” which is the meaning of prajñā.

original: lte ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: lte ba ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two centers:

original: de nyid sprul pa'i 'khor lo gtum mo'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid sprul pa'i 'khor lo gtum mo'i bdag nyid do //
translated: the center of the emanation wheel itself, which is the nature of caṇḍālī.

original: h'um gi yig 'bru ni /
analyzed: h'um gi yig 'bru ni /
translated: The syllable hūṃ

original: chos khyi 'khor lor lte bar bzhugs pa /
analyzed: chos khyi 'khor lor lte bar bzhugs pa /
translated: resides in the center of the dharmacakra.

original: thugs rdo rje'i sa bon thabs kyi mtshan nyid bskyod pa'i las bgyid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thugs rdo rje'i sa bon thabs kyi mtshan nyid bskyod pa'i las bgyid pa'i phyir /
translated: The seed of the mind vajra, which has the characteristic of method, performs the function of shaking.

original: drag po chen por grags te /
analyzed: drag po chen por grags te /
translated: Therefore, it is renowned as “great wrath.”

original: 'dir yang sngar bzhin dbye'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang sngar bzhin dbye'o //
translated: Here, as before, it is divided.

original: thabs dang shes rab bcom ldan 'das dpal ye shes thig le dang / yum phyag rgya chen mo'i rang bzhin las kyi @255a * //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab bcom ldan 'das dpal ye shes thig le dang / yum phyag rgya chen mo'i rang bzhin las kyi @255a * //
translated: The Bhagavān is the nature of the great seal, the mother, and the method and wisdom of the glorious jñānatilaka.

original: rlung gis dam tshig gi bdag nyid bskyod pa ni /
analyzed: rlung gis dam tshig gi bdag nyid bskyod pa ni /
translated: The commitment nature is shaken by the karma vāyu.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba //
translated: It is free from conceptuality.

original: bskal pa'i me 'od dang mnyam pa //
analyzed: bskal pa'i me 'od dang mnyam pa //
translated: It is equal to the light of the fire of the eon.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so forth.

original: dbus na gang zhig 'khor lo yod //
analyzed: dbus na gang zhig 'khor lo yod //
translated: In the center, there is a wheel.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i padma sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi lte bar bde ba chen po'i sku'i sa bon dang / sku dang / gsung dang / thugs dang / dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin du gnas so //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i padma sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi lte bar bde ba chen po'i sku'i sa bon dang / sku dang / gsung dang / thugs dang / dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin du gnas so //
translated: In the center of the thirty-two petals of the great-bliss wheel, the seed of the great-bliss body, and the nature of the indivisibility of body, speech, and mind, is present.

original: srog gi rlung dang / nye ba'i srog dang tshim byed kyi rlung dang / de gsum dbyer med par gnas pa ni /
analyzed: srog gi rlung dang / nye ba'i srog dang tshim byed kyi rlung dang / de gsum dbyer med par gnas pa ni /
translated: The life-force wind, the life-force-approximator wind, and the satisfying wind are present as indivisible.

original: srog gi rlung gi gi rang gi ngo bo zhes so //
analyzed: srog gi rlung gi gi rang gi ngo bo zhes so //
translated: The nature of the life-force wind is the life-force wind.

original: bde ba'i byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa ni de'i yon tan gyis snying gar 'ongs nas so //
analyzed: bde ba'i byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa ni de'i yon tan gyis snying gar 'ongs nas so //
translated: The falling of the bodhicitta of bliss is the arrival of its qualities at the heart.

original: mtshan ma'i rtags ma byung ba ji srid pa de srid kyi bar du gnas pa de ni gnas su'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i rtags ma byung ba ji srid pa de srid kyi bar du gnas pa de ni gnas su'o //
translated: The abiding is the abiding there for as long as the signs of the signs do not arise.

original: de'i phyir rtag tu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag tu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “always,” and so on.

original: 'on yang bla ma'i thal nas zhal du brgyud pa'i bshad par /
analyzed: 'on yang bla ma'i thal nas zhal du brgyud pa'i bshad par /
translated: However, in the explanation that is transmitted orally from the mouth of the guru,

original: de nas aom yig rang ngor grags //
analyzed: de nas aom yig rang ngor grags //
translated: “Then, the sound of the syllable oṃ is heard.”

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i byang chub kyis sems sku gsum dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin bde ba chen po'i sku dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i byang chub kyis sems sku gsum dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin bde ba chen po'i sku dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The conventional and ultimate awakening minds, along with the body of great bliss, which is the nature of the inseparability of the three buddha bodies.

original: des ni 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: des ni 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is taught by the following:

original: sngags dang dbyibs dang chos bdag nyid //
analyzed: sngags dang dbyibs dang chos bdag nyid //
translated: The mantra, the shape, and the nature of phenomena

original: sbyor ba rnams pa gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: sbyor ba rnams pa gsum du 'dod //
translated: are asserted to be the three aspects of yoga.🔽And:

original: ces bya ba dang / kha dog dbyings ni sprul pa'i sku //
analyzed: ces bya ba dang / kha dog dbyings ni sprul pa'i sku //
translated: The realm of color is the emanation body.

original: sngags ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku //
analyzed: sngags ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku //
translated: The mantra is the enjoyment body.

original: chos kyi rang bzhin chos kyi sku //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin chos kyi sku //
translated: The nature of phenomena is the truth body.

original: dbyer med sku ni bde chen pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dbyer med sku ni bde chen pa'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The inseparable body is great bliss.

original: sku de rgyal po bde ba chen po 'di rdo rje 'dzin nyid rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid byang chub sems kyi ye shes spros pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i 'di yid pas na /
analyzed: sku de rgyal po bde ba chen po 'di rdo rje 'dzin nyid rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid byang chub sems kyi ye shes spros pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i 'di yid pas na /
translated: This body of the great bliss king is the nature of Vajradhara, the wisdom of the awakening mind free from elaborations.

original: rnam par shes pa sku rgyal nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa sku rgyal nyid du bshad do //
translated: Therefore, consciousness is explained to be the king of bodies.

original: yang na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mi long lta bu'i ye shes su thim pa'o //
analyzed: yang na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mi long lta bu'i ye shes su thim pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, the all-base consciousness dissolves into mirror-like wisdom.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes /
translated: The afflicted mind is the wisdom of equality.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes /
translated: The mental consciousness is the wisdom of discernment.

original: tshogs kyi rnam par shes pa ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes /
analyzed: tshogs kyi rnam par shes pa ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes /
translated: The consciousness of the aggregate is the wisdom of successful activities.

original: de rnams kun ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de rnams kun ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
translated: All of them are the wisdom of the dharmadhātu.

original: bla ma'i zhal nas rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: bla ma'i zhal nas rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: The guru says that consciousness

original: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin /
translated: is the nature of the five wisdoms.

original: de ni sku gsum gyi bdag nyid bde ba chen po'i sku gnyis su med pa'i ye shes @255b su gnas kyang bsams gtan pa las dang pho pas nam mkha'i zla ba bzhin mthong bar mi gyur te /
analyzed: de ni sku gsum gyi bdag nyid bde ba chen po'i sku gnyis su med pa'i ye shes @255b su gnas kyang bsams gtan pa las dang pho pas nam mkha'i zla ba bzhin mthong bar mi gyur te /
translated: Although that is the nature of the three kāyas, the gnosis of the nondual kāya of great bliss, it is not seen, like the moon in the sky, due to the fault of one’s own concepts.🔽Why is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: It is said that it is not seen because one’s concepts are impure.🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice

original: rang gi rnam par rtog pa ma dag pa'i phyir /🔽mi mthong ngo zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: rang gi rnam par rtog pa ma dag pa'i phyir / mi mthong ngo zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice

original: srog dang rngub pa 'gog pa yis //
analyzed: srog dang rngub pa 'gog pa yis //
translated: The Explanation of the Method of Practice

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation of the Method of Practice

original: srog ni phyir rgyu ba'i rlung dang / nang du rgyu ba'i rang bzhin ni rngub pa /
analyzed: srog ni phyir rgyu ba'i rlung dang / nang du rgyu ba'i rang bzhin ni rngub pa /
translated: The Explanation of the Method of Practice🔽The Explanation

original: 'gog pa ni mnyam par gnas pa'i dus bsam du med pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni mnyam par gnas pa'i dus bsam du med pa'i don to //
translated: Cessation is the meaning of the inconceivable at the time of equipoise.

original: de dag ni bzang po'i dus 'o ma'i rgyun bzhin 'bab pa dang / ngan pa'i dus ma'i gzugs kyis 'gro ba dang / gnyig med pa'i ye shes kyi de kho na nyid bsam du med par mnyam pa'i dang zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de dag ni bzang po'i dus 'o ma'i rgyun bzhin 'bab pa dang / ngan pa'i dus ma'i gzugs kyis 'gro ba dang / gnyig med pa'i ye shes kyi de kho na nyid bsam du med par mnyam pa'i dang zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Those are the meanings of the good time, the flow like a stream of milk, the bad time, the going by the form of a mother, and the inconceivable equipoise of the reality of the gnosis that is free from both.

original: srog dang rngub pa bza' ba gsol //
analyzed: srog dang rngub pa bza' ba gsol //
translated: The life and the breath are the food that is eaten.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa go sla'o //
translated: And so forth.

original: de rnams rnal 'byor dbang shes nas //
analyzed: de rnams rnal 'byor dbang shes nas //
translated: Having known those, the lord of yogins

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: And so forth.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i don gyis bla ma nyid kyi bshad gzhung gi man ngag brgyud pa'i man ngag rim pa thob pas bshad cing par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i don gyis bla ma nyid kyi bshad gzhung gi man ngag brgyud pa'i man ngag rim pa thob pas bshad cing par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Having obtained the stages of the oral instructions of the lineage of the explanatory texts of the guru himself by means of the meaning of the stage of completion, one should explain.🔽If it is asked what is the meaning of the stage of completion, it is the meaning of the stage of completion that is explained by the guru.

original: sgra tshad la sogs pa'i blo zhe na /🔽pas 'dir ni ma yin zhes 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: sgra tshad la sogs pa'i blo zhe na / pas 'dir ni ma yin zhes 'brel pa'o //
translated: If it is asked what is the meaning of the stage of completion, it is the meaning of the stage of completion that is explained by the guru.

original: de'i phyir bla ma mnyes par bya //
analyzed: de'i phyir bla ma mnyes par bya //
translated: Therefore, one should please the guru.

original: zhes so // 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: zhes so // 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: gang zhig nyer 'gro'i bsam gtan ni //
analyzed: gang zhig nyer 'gro'i bsam gtan ni //
translated: The concentration of the one who goes near

original: de ni zla ba gyen du byed //
analyzed: de ni zla ba gyen du byed //
translated: It is the moon turned upside down.

original: yang na tshangs bzhi rnam dbye byas //
analyzed: yang na tshangs bzhi rnam dbye byas //
translated: Or else, the four Brahmas are divided.

original: rnam par shes la gshegs par gsol //
analyzed: rnam par shes la gshegs par gsol //
translated: One should request the descent of consciousness.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: de bzhin du gzhung gnyis su bstan cing bshad bshad do /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhung gnyis su bstan cing bshad bshad do /
translated: Similarly, it is taught and explained in the two texts.

original: 'di la ta bu'i 'dus pa'i sa'i dur khrod chen po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la ta bu'i 'dus pa'i sa'i dur khrod chen po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the great charnel ground of the assembly of the earth means

original: gnas 'dir mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa dam tshig can thams cad 'du zhing nyon mongs pa'i bgegs 'byung po rnams rlag par byed pa bdag dang dur khrod chen po mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gnas 'dir mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa dam tshig can thams cad 'du zhing nyon mongs pa'i bgegs 'byung po rnams rlag par byed pa bdag dang dur khrod chen po mtshan nyid do //
translated: that in this place, all those with samaya, such as the dakinis, gather and destroy the obstructing bhutas of afflictions. This is the characteristic of the great charnel ground of oneself.

original: 'khor ba'i chos phung po la sogs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa thams cad 'byung ba'i chos mthun pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i chos phung po la sogs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa thams cad 'byung ba'i chos mthun pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is similar to the Dharma that produces all the dharmas of samsara, such as the aggregates, and the dharmas of nirvana, such as the immeasurable qualities of the Tathagata,

original: chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi phyir zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi phyir zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called the source of phenomena.

original: gnas khyab par can 'di'i yon tan gyis /
analyzed: gnas khyab par can 'di'i yon tan gyis /
translated: By the qualities of this pervasive place,

original: brangs  med pa'i rnal 'byor phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob ces bya ba la sogs pa sgra ji sgra ji bzhin par gsungs so //
analyzed: brangs  med pa'i rnal 'byor phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob ces bya ba la sogs pa sgra ji sgra ji bzhin par gsungs so //
translated: The yogi who is not deceived attains the spiritual power of the great seal.

original: dpal ye shes thig le'i dka' 'grel gsang ba'i de kho na nyid ces bya ba le'u @256a * //
analyzed: dpal ye shes thig le'i dka' 'grel gsang ba'i de kho na nyid ces bya ba le'u @256a * //
translated: The commentary on the glorious Essence of Pristine Awareness called the Secret of All Secret Tantra,

original: bcu bdun pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: bcu bdun pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: the explanation of chapter seventeen.

original: // / yang bcom ldan mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽srog gi dbyug pa'i gnag zhig steng //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: // / yang bcom ldan mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // srog gi dbyug pa'i gnag zhig steng // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Again, the Bhagavatī and so forth is stated.

original: srog gi dbyug pa ni dbus kyi srog rtsa ni kun gyi steng gi dngos po ka ba'i gzugs su gnas pa'o //🔽mgrin pa'i steng nas yang ni /
analyzed: srog gi dbyug pa ni dbus kyi srog rtsa ni kun gyi steng gi dngos po ka ba'i gzugs su gnas pa'o // mgrin pa'i steng nas yang ni /
translated: The staff of life is the central life channel, which is the entity above all, existing in the form of a pillar.

original: rang nyid kyi sor gyis gzhal na sor bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: rang nyid kyi sor gyis gzhal na sor bcu gnyis te /
translated: Above the throat, again means that it is twelve fingerbreadths when measured by one's own fingers.

original: spyi bo'i gtsug nas mgrin pa'i steng gi bar du cha phra ba tsam ste /
analyzed: spyi bo'i gtsug nas mgrin pa'i steng gi bar du cha phra ba tsam ste /
translated: From the crown of the head to above the throat, it is just a subtle part.

original: mdud pa med ces grangs pas na /
analyzed: mdud pa med ces grangs pas na /
translated: Since it is counted as without a knot,

original: gang zhig steng zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zhig steng zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is stated, that which is above and so forth.

original: 'og gi cha ni bcu gnyis phyed //
analyzed: 'og gi cha ni bcu gnyis phyed //
translated: The lower part is twelve finger-breadths.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: sprul pa'i gnas thabs dang shes rab kyis rdo rje dang padma'i tshad ni sor drug tu bshad de /
analyzed: sprul pa'i gnas thabs dang shes rab kyis rdo rje dang padma'i tshad ni sor drug tu bshad de /
translated: The measure of the vajra and lotus of the method and wisdom emanation places is said to be six finger-breadths.

original: 'on kyang mthun pa ma yin pa'i tsha ni 'dir ma bshad de /
analyzed: 'on kyang mthun pa ma yin pa'i tsha ni 'dir ma bshad de /
translated: However, the unfavorable measurements are not explained here.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Just so”

original: mdud pa dang grangs kyi rim pa bstan pa la bsnyag go //
analyzed: mdud pa dang grangs kyi rim pa bstan pa la bsnyag go //
translated: refers to the sequence of the knots and enumeration.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid sprul pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid sprul pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of samsara and nirvana is emanation.

original: sprul ba'i gnas kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: sprul ba'i gnas kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The emanation place is the chakra.

original: rtsa ba'i padma la gos pa med pa'i don dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i padma la gos pa med pa'i don dang ldan pa ni /
translated: The meaning of being unstained by the root lotus

original: padma'i 'dab ma'i rim pa'i grangs so //
analyzed: padma'i 'dab ma'i rim pa'i grangs so //
translated: is the enumeration of the stages of the lotus petals.

original: de yang rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'o //
translated: That also is endowed with yoga.🔽This is the meaning of the sixty-four, eight, and three petals.

original: 'di ni 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi dang brgyad dang / gsum pa'i don ni drug gi phyed do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi dang brgyad dang / gsum pa'i don ni drug gi phyed do //
translated: The meaning of six is half.

original: de nyid kyi gnas bgyid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi gnas bgyid pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it serves as the location of that,

original: spyan 'dra padma zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: spyan 'dra padma zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the eye is called the lotus.

original: 'di ni 'dab ma gsum pa'i lte ba dang bcas pa'i bdag nyid ye shes kyi spyan snying por bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dab ma gsum pa'i lte ba dang bcas pa'i bdag nyid ye shes kyi spyan snying por bshad do //
translated: This is explained as the essence of the eye of wisdom, which is the nature of the navel of the three petals.

original: srog pa rtsa'i snying po 'di rtsa thams cad kyi rtsa ba de dang bcas pa ni /
analyzed: srog pa rtsa'i snying po 'di rtsa thams cad kyi rtsa ba de dang bcas pa ni /
translated: This essence of the life channel is the root of all channels.

original: 'dzin ma dang / ro ma dang rtog med ma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dzin ma dang / ro ma dang rtog med ma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the meaning of the terms “avah,” “rasana,” and “madhyama.”

original: lte nang du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lte nang du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ In the middle of the navel”

original: 'khor lo rnams kyi lte ba'i bdag nyid srog rtsa de'i nang na gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo rnams kyi lte ba'i bdag nyid srog rtsa de'i nang na gsum pa'o //
translated: means that the third is inside that life channel, which is the nature of the navel of the cakras.🔽All phenomena are the root of the cause of the appearance of bodhicitta, great bliss.

original: chos thams cad ni byang chub kyi sems snang ba bde ba chen po'i rgyus rtsa ba nyid dus rtag tu rtog med ma dang ldan pa'i don gyis tshangs pa'i dbyug par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni byang chub kyi sems snang ba bde ba chen po'i rgyus rtsa ba nyid dus rtag tu rtog med ma dang ldan pa'i don gyis tshangs pa'i dbyug par bshad pa'o //
translated: The meaning of being endowed with the madhyamā is explained as the staff of Brahmā.

original: de nyid kyi rang bzhin /🔽rtsa ba rtsa yi nang 'ongs nas //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rang bzhin / rtsa ba rtsa yi nang 'ongs nas //
translated: That very nature

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is the root, which has come into the channel.

original: padma'i 'dab ma gsum la sogs pa sprul pa'i 'khor lor gnas pa'i reg bya dang bral ba'i 'dab ma'o //
analyzed: padma'i 'dab ma gsum la sogs pa sprul pa'i 'khor lor gnas pa'i reg bya dang bral ba'i 'dab ma'o //
translated: The three petals of the lotus and so on are the petals free from contact that exist in the emanation cakra.

original: skye ru bcar te gnas zhes bya ba ni rtsa gsum po'i 'dab ma'i sker srog rtsa bcar @256b nas gnas pa ni /
analyzed: skye ru bcar te gnas zhes bya ba ni rtsa gsum po'i 'dab ma'i sker srog rtsa bcar @256b nas gnas pa ni /
translated: The line and abides in the place of birth means that the life-channel abides in the place of the three channels' petals.

original: gnas dang gnas pa'i tshul du 'khyud pa'i dngos por gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas pa'i tshul du 'khyud pa'i dngos por gnas pa'o //
translated: It abides in the form of embracing the three channels in the manner of a place and an inhabitant.

original: gug pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bor grags //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gug pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bor grags // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is renowned as having the nature of a hook.🔽The line within the eight petals is the three petals means that

original: 'dab ma brgyad pa'i nang du 'dab ma gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma brgyad pa'i nang du 'dab ma gsum pa'o //
translated: the three channels are within the eight petals.

original: de'i nang na gnas pa'i lte ba bya gtor ma dang bcas pa'i gug pa'i zhes 'khyud pa'i mtshan nyid can bzhi byed pa'o //🔽bug phra mos nang nas ldan //
analyzed: de'i nang na gnas pa'i lte ba bya gtor ma dang bcas pa'i gug pa'i zhes 'khyud pa'i mtshan nyid can bzhi byed pa'o // bug phra mos nang nas ldan //
translated: The line within that, the four hooks of the navel with the sacrificial animal means that the four hooks, which have the characteristic of embracing, are within the three channels.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The line endowed with the subtle opening means that

original: srog ma'i bdag nyid rtsa gsum dang bcas nas /
analyzed: srog ma'i bdag nyid rtsa gsum dang bcas nas /
translated: the three channels, which are the nature of the life-channel,🔽are endowed with the subtle opening of the nonconceptual [mind].

original: lar rtog med ma shin tu cha phra ba'i sngod  bu dang bcas pa sa'i myu gu'i rnam pa rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: lar rtog med ma shin tu cha phra ba'i sngod  bu dang bcas pa sa'i myu gu'i rnam pa rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i dbye bas so //
translated: The line the seed of the sprout of the earth means that the life-channel is the cause and the result, divided into the seed and the sprout.🔽The line the life-channel itself is the support of the three realms means that

original: de ni srog ba rtsa ni nyid //
analyzed: de ni srog ba rtsa ni nyid //
translated: the life-channel is the support of the three realms.🔽The line the three realms are the result of the life-channel means that

original: khams gsum du ni rten yin no //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khams gsum du ni rten yin no //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the three realms are the result of the life-channel.

original: srog pa rtsa 'di 'dod khams la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi rten 'di rang khams gsum gyi sgra ni /
analyzed: srog pa rtsa 'di 'dod khams la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi rten 'di rang khams gsum gyi sgra ni /
translated: This life channel is the support of the nature of the desire realm and so on.

original: lus la sogs pa 'dzin ma dang / ro ma dang / rtog med ma'i rten /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa 'dzin ma dang / ro ma dang / rtog med ma'i rten /
translated: The sound of the three realms is the support of the body and so on, the lalanā, rasanā, and avadhūti.

original: yang na dga' ba gsum gyi rten byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na dga' ba gsum gyi rten byed pa yin no //
translated: Alternately, it is the support of the three joys.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis med kyis //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis med kyis //
translated: The cause and result are nondual.

original: zhes bya ba ni srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu 'bras so sor bde ba'i don gnyis su med pa'i ye shes spros pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin dga' bas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu 'bras so sor bde ba'i don gnyis su med pa'i ye shes spros pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin dga' bas /
translated: The cause and result of samsara and nirvana are the two benefits of bliss, the pristine consciousness of nondual wisdom, the nature free from proliferation, and joy.

original: rtsa ba 'bras bu rgya yis btab //
analyzed: rtsa ba 'bras bu rgya yis btab //
translated: The root is sealed by the result.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: It is also said.

original: yang na rgyu rtsa'i dngos po 'bras bu mkha' 'gro ma'i mtshan nyid de dag rnams dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes spros pa dang bral ba'i bde ba chen pos rgyas btab pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyu rtsa'i dngos po 'bras bu mkha' 'gro ma'i mtshan nyid de dag rnams dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes spros pa dang bral ba'i bde ba chen pos rgyas btab pa'o //
translated: Alternately, the nature of the entity of the causal nāḍīs and the characteristics of the resultant dakinis are the great, innate bliss of the wisdom of the inseparable nature, free from proliferation.🔽The root with six and a half is

original: drug phyed rtsa ba dang ldan na //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: drug phyed rtsa ba dang ldan na //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: If one has the six and a half roots,🔽and so forth.🔽

original: rtsa bzhi po'i dbyibs 'di la brten pas bcom ldan 'das dpal ye shes thig le 'grub par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtsa bzhi po'i dbyibs 'di la brten pas bcom ldan 'das dpal ye shes thig le 'grub par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the Bhagavān Śrī Jñānatilaka is accomplished in dependence on the shape of these four nāḍīs,

original: sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: as explained above.

original: rtsa gsum dbye ni 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid can sprul pa'i sku'i bskyed rim gyi skabs su rtsa gsum ste /
analyzed: rtsa gsum dbye ni 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid can sprul pa'i sku'i bskyed rim gyi skabs su rtsa gsum ste /
translated: The three nāḍīs are differentiated in the context of the creation stage of the nirmāṇakāya, which has the characteristics of saṃsāra.

original: de nas srog pa rtsa chags /
analyzed: de nas srog pa rtsa chags /
translated: Then the life nāḍī is formed.

original: de nas rtsa gzhan rim gyis skye //
analyzed: de nas rtsa gzhan rim gyis skye //
translated: Then the other nāḍīs gradually arise.

original: zhes bcom ldan 'das yum la bka' stsal to //
analyzed: zhes bcom ldan 'das yum la bka' stsal to //
translated: The Bhagavān said this to the mother.

original: gzhan na nge rtsa ni srog pa rtsa yin /
analyzed: gzhan na nge rtsa ni srog pa rtsa yin /
translated: The other nāḍīs are the life nāḍī.🔽The three divisions are the three petals.

original: gsum du dbye ba ni 'dab ma gsum pa'i de bzhin rtsa gsum de rang 'bras bu yin zer ro //
analyzed: gsum du dbye ba ni 'dab ma gsum pa'i de bzhin rtsa gsum de rang 'bras bu yin zer ro //
translated: The three common to both are the three results.🔽The three that are mutually related are the three causes and results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.

original: phan tshul 'brel par gcig dang gsum du bshad pa ni 'jug pa'i dang ldan pa'i rim pas rgyu dang 'bras @257a * //🔽bum thun par gsum ni /
analyzed: phan tshul 'brel par gcig dang gsum du bshad pa ni 'jug pa'i dang ldan pa'i rim pas rgyu dang 'bras @257a * // bum thun par gsum ni /
translated: The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.

original: 'bras bu yang de bzhin yod do //🔽rtsa ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang de bzhin yod do //🔽rtsa ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa ni /
translated: The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.🔽The three that are common to both cause and result are the three results.

original: sngon du bstan pa'i sor drug pa'i dngos kyis gnas bshad pa'o //🔽de nyid ni rtog pa'i mtshan nyid 'joms pa'i gnas rtsub pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon du bstan pa'i sor drug pa'i dngos kyis gnas bshad pa'o // de nyid ni rtog pa'i mtshan nyid 'joms pa'i gnas rtsub pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The place of the six fingerbreadths previously explained is explained by the🔽actual [measurement].🔽That itself is subtle because it is difficult to grasp, since it is not the domain🔽of those with discursive thoughts, because it is not a rough place that

original: 'jam pa'i rtog pa can gyi spyod yul ma yin pas gzung bar dka' ba'i phyir phra ba /
analyzed: 'jam pa'i rtog pa can gyi spyod yul ma yin pas gzung bar dka' ba'i phyir phra ba /
translated: destroys the characteristics of conceptuality.🔽Since it pervades from the

original: bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i mtha' nas gsang ba'i rin po che'i gnas su khyab pas ni /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i mtha' nas gsang ba'i rin po che'i gnas su khyab pas ni /
translated: edge of the great chakra of great bliss to the place of the secret jewel,

original: rin chen kha nang yan chad de de'o //
analyzed: rin chen kha nang yan chad de de'o //
translated: it is the jewel that faces inward.🔽Others say that the vajra is six fingerbreadths and the jewel is two

original: gzhan na re rdo rje la sor drug ni rin po che la sor gnyis /
analyzed: gzhan na re rdo rje la sor drug ni rin po che la sor gnyis /
translated: fingerbreadths.

original: de'i phyir / rin chen kha nang yan chad do ;🔽/ zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rin chen kha nang yan chad do ; / zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, it is the jewel that faces inward.

original: de ni phra ba dang 'jam pa'i gnas so //🔽'di skad du /🔽slob dpon kha cig gi gzhung las phra ba dang 'jam pa'i /
analyzed: de ni phra ba dang 'jam pa'i gnas so // 'di skad du / slob dpon kha cig gi gzhung las phra ba dang 'jam pa'i /
translated: That is the place of subtlety and smoothness.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: In this regard, some masters say that the place of subtlety and smoothness🔽is the place of the secret jewel.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo ni sems kyi gnas yin pas phra mo 'jam zhes bshad pa dang / yang lte ba'i gnas phra la 'jam zhes pa dang / yang bzhi pa'i gnas nyid ni shin tu phra mo 'jam zhes bya ba dang / yang 'khor lo kun gyi thog ma'i padma'i lte ba'i dbus phra mo 'jam zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo ni sems kyi gnas yin pas phra mo 'jam zhes bshad pa dang / yang lte ba'i gnas phra la 'jam zhes pa dang / yang bzhi pa'i gnas nyid ni shin tu phra mo 'jam zhes bya ba dang / yang 'khor lo kun gyi thog ma'i padma'i lte ba'i dbus phra mo 'jam zhes bya ba dang /
translated: Also, the center of the center of the lotus of all the wheels is called “subtle and soft.”🔽Also, the place of the nature of the six unions of the nāḍīs is called “subtle and soft.”

original: yang rtsa sbyor ba drug gi bdag nyid kyi gnas ni phra mo 'jam zhes bya ba dang / slob dpon dang dpal badzra pu ti'i zhal snga nas dbus kyi rtsub la ;
analyzed: yang rtsa sbyor ba drug gi bdag nyid kyi gnas ni phra mo 'jam zhes bya ba dang / slob dpon dang dpal badzra pu ti'i zhal snga nas dbus kyi rtsub la ;
translated: The master and Śrī Vajrapāṇi explain that the center is “rough” and

original: tha ma'i gnas ni phra mo 'jam pa bdag nyid rang bzhin dga' ba'i yi shes kyi gnas nye bar lta ba zhes bshad do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tha ma'i gnas ni phra mo 'jam pa bdag nyid rang bzhin dga' ba'i yi shes kyi gnas nye bar lta ba zhes bshad do zhes gsungs so //
translated: the final place is “subtle and soft,” the place of the pristine consciousness of natural joy, which is called “the view.”

original: de tsam ye shes thig skud yod / ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de tsam ye shes thig skud yod / ces bya ba ni /
translated: That much is the thread of pristine consciousness.

original: rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi nad du yod pa'i 'khor lo drug gi lte ba'i nang du gnas pa sbyor ba drug gi ye shes snang bar byed pa /
analyzed: rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi nad du yod pa'i 'khor lo drug gi lte ba'i nang du gnas pa sbyor ba drug gi ye shes snang bar byed pa /
translated: The pristine consciousness of the six unions appears within the center of the six cakras, which are the location of the seventy-two thousand nāḍīs.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyis rang gi tshogs kyi 'khor lo la dbang sgyur bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyis rang gi tshogs kyi 'khor lo la dbang sgyur bar byed pa'o //
translated: The pristine consciousness of nonduality controls one’s gaṇacakra.

original: de'i phyir rnam shes drug ces bya ba la sogs pa'i don gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam shes drug ces bya ba la sogs pa'i don gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of “the six consciousnesses” and so on is explained.

original: da ni dpal ye shes thig le'i tshad dang / sbyor ba drug gi rang bzhin dbyer med pa'i don bshad de /
analyzed: da ni dpal ye shes thig le'i tshad dang / sbyor ba drug gi rang bzhin dbyer med pa'i don bshad de /
translated: Now, the measure of the glorious bindu of pristine consciousness and the meaning of the indivisibility of the nature of the six unions will be explained.

original: shr'i ni gzhan min 'dir ni cha //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni /
analyzed: shr'i ni gzhan min 'dir ni cha // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni /
translated: Śrī means “not other” here.

original: shr'i dzny'a na ti la ka zhes bya ba'i mtshan gyis sbyor ba drug gi don ni cha dang / thig le dang / tshul dang / tshul tsam dang // mchog dang / gzhan mchog rnams rim pa bzhin du sbyar @257b ba'i man ngag 'dir bshad pa ni /
analyzed: shr'i dzny'a na ti la ka zhes bya ba'i mtshan gyis sbyor ba drug gi don ni cha dang / thig le dang / tshul dang / tshul tsam dang // mchog dang / gzhan mchog rnams rim pa bzhin du sbyar @257b ba'i man ngag 'dir bshad pa ni /
